posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Weâ€™re releasing the Signal 7.39 beta soon. If youâ€™re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

Notes TBD, but some higlights

  • You can now schedule voice messages (need to lock recording first, then long-press send)
  • The UI for saving lots of media to disk all at once is a lot better

Complete list of new commits since 7.38.7:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.38.7â€¦main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.38 release
Scheduled send of voice message + bug

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.39.0 (153100)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

142 new commits since 7.38.7:

Show commits

  • Prevent duplicate restore local attachment jobs from being enqueue. [1]

  • Fix message backup checkout e2e tests. [2]

  • Fix InAppPayments database inconsistency. [3]

  • Do not display backups warnings if backups are disabled in remote configuration. [4]

  • Improve logging around setting backup tier. [5]

  • Make the backup remote config field active. [6]

  • Fix issue where were were sometimes backing up an empty CDN key. [7]

  • Migrate paypal and stripe interactions to durable background jobs. [8]

  • Fix draft lost bug when leaving media send flow. [9]

  • Fix spoiler rendering in story captions. [10]

  • Convert WebSocket messaging apis to NetworkResult. [11]

  • Convert SVR and GV2 auth requests to WebSocket. [12]

  • Update conversation header with group members. [13]

  • Convert prekey requests to WebSocket. [14]

  • Convert provisioning and certificate endpoints to WebSocket and finalize attachments. [15]

  • Convert remaining profile apis to use WebSockets and remove REST fallback. [16]

  • Fix races causing flakes in LibSignalChatConnectionTest. [17]

  • Ensure payment is in proper state before popping external iDEAL authorization. [18]

  • Improve calling reliability with relay server response cache. [19]

  • Add several registered checks. [20]

  • Use standard avatar blur gradient algorithm. [21]

  • Add unit testing for SharedInAppPaymentPipeline. [22]

  • Fix unit tests missing isRegistered check. [23]

  • Add test for unregistered user state to InAppPaymentRecurringContextJobTest. [24]

  • Add internal setting for forcing backup tier. [25]

  • Add custom STOPSHIP handling. [26]

  • Utilize newBuilder instead of copy in unit test. [27]

  • Add unit tests to check for unregistered state. [28]

  • Add internal settings button to add dummy messages. [29]

  • Format backup progress numbers. [30]

  • Update with newBuilder. [31]

  • Do not create one-time receipt during auth check. [32]

  • Convert remote config apis to WebSocket. [33]

  • Add excluded directories to STOPSHIP task. [34]

  • Fix conversation header position. [35]

  • Eliminate zero-sized samples from contributing to the audio track. [36]

    Eliminating unnecessary and potentially counter-productive zero-sized
    samples from the audio trak. The Android MP4 multiplexer tends to add
    them at the very end of the audio stream. Their presence may negatively
    affect the declared audio stream duration, and pose further complications
    down the road.
    The changes are verified on Samsung A54 (Android 14) device.

  • Do not show outgoing calls in missed call filter. [37]

  • Fix potential crash if snackbar action is processed when fragment is not attached. [38]

  • Clean up imports in InAppPaumentAuthCheckJob. [39]

  • Consolidate attachment saving logic into unified AttachmentSaver class. [40]

    Introduces AttachmentSaver to centralize all of the steps needed to save message attachments to the device storage. It handles the entire workflow including:

    • Showing the save to storage warning/confirmation dialog.
    • Requesting WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission.
    • Showing/dismissing media save progress.
      Goals of this new class:
    • Make it easy to save media attachments anywhere with just a few lines of code (and easier to replace the deprecated SaveAttachmentTask).
    • Ensure all of the necessary steps are consistently performed at each usage site (which wasn't the case before).
    • Make it easier to unit test the save attachment logic.

  • Add unit test coverage for AttachmentSaver. [41]

  • Use AttachmentSaver to save story images. [42]

  • Pause story playback while saving media. [43]

    Story playback was previously paused when the context menu is opened, but resumed while saving the media.
    With this change, playback will remain paused while saving media, so the user doesn't potentially miss any stories while clicking through the dialogs to save media to their device storage.

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.3 [44]

  • Fix incorrect showing of backups enabled bottom sheet on flow exit. [45]

  • Add .compose and .view subpackages to core-ui module. [46]

  • Clean up chat folder records. [47]

  • Add verify AEP screen. [48]

  • Fix chevron placement for rtl languages. [49]

  • Add date to linked device notification. [50]

  • Improve display and management of backup progress. [51]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.67.6 [52]

  • Add auto-fill backup key support. [53]

  • Update attachment backfill proto. [54]

  • Adjust LibSignalChatConnection.disconnect() so we only transition to DISCONNECTED once. [55]

  • Reject invalid TLS proxy configurations. [56]

  • Update rules for expiring messages in backupsV2. [57]

  • Update android.yml [58]

    Update libs
    Fix node.js<20 deprecation
    deprecated by gradle/actions/wrapper-validation.

  • Update benchmark-libs.versions.toml [59]

    Fix cve2020-15250
    https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-15250

  • Preserve search term when refreshing contacts. [60]

    Fixes #14051

  • Use AttachmentSaver to save image editor files to device storage. [61]

  • Update MockK to v1.13.17 [62]

    To get access to the fix for mockk/mockk#939.

  • Use AttachmentSaver to save media preview files to device storage. [63]

  • Fix ktlinformat on windows. [64]

  • Rewrite bottom navigation in compose. [65]

  • Implement auto-lower-hand. [66]

  • Fix missing toast message after write external storage permission is denied while saving an attachment. [67]

    AttachmentSaver was missing logic to show a toast message after the user denies WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission.

    Changeset

    • Add missing toast after write external storage permission is denied.
    • Add unit test coverage for AttachmentSaver result messages.
    • Rename AttachmentSaver string resource names so they all have the same prefix.

  • Add support for configuration cache. [68]

  • Fix gv2 create/join bugs when profile credential is invalid. [69]

  • Migrate Help Settings Fragment to Compose [70]

  • Fix Save/Reset chat wallpaper crashes. [71]

  • Fix Re-register screen UI. [72]

  • Adjust footer offset on collapsed text items. [73]

  • Convert MainActivity to Kotlin. [74]

  • Add support for audio to start from a seek position. [75]

  • Fix emoji picker weird scrolling in RTL. [76]

  • Add "Tap to remove" option for emoji in ReactionsBottomSheet. [77]

  • Add and use special monospace typeface for AEP. [78]

  • Remove unneeded test timeout. [79]

  • Update lint-baseline.xml [80]

  • Replace main activity xml with AppScaffold. [81]

  • Fix nightly-url logic. [82]

  • Support scroll for Scheduled Message dialog sheets. [83]

  • Support dynamically updating common groups in recipient settings. [84]

  • Use AttachmentSaver to save media overview files to device storage. [85]

  • Fix incorrect state by Cycling restore decision state key. [86]

  • Update restore complete banner ux. [87]

  • Fix BubbleBanner dismiss click listener. [88]

  • Fix crash when changing username on Android API < 24. [89]

    Basically, the crash was caused by using Collections.unmodifiableList(), which creates an UnmodifiableCollection wrapper around the original List.
    That UnmodifiableCollection wrapper contains methods that return java.util.stream.Stream â€“ which was added in Java 8, but can be used on Android API < 24 through desugaring.
    However, it appears that when Jackson is using reflection to serialize ReserveUsernameRequest, it examines all of the methods of that class. This results in a java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.util.stream.Stream, because the reflection is looking at the actual runtime UnmodifiableCollection class and not desugared code.
    As far as I can tell, that behavior is unavoidable and the only way to avoid this issue is to avoid using Collections.unmodifiableList() in classes that are serialized by Jackson on Android API < 24.

  • Inline the attachment backfill flag. [90]

  • Update README.md copyright. [91]

    Closes #14060

  • Fix instrumentation tests for payments. [92]

  • Fix missing thumbnail background color. [93]

  • Improve byteCountEstimate calculation for videos. [94]

  • Add ability to Self-heal SEPA bug. [95]

  • Update dim button state on reset wallpaper. [96]

  • Update blur face button state on clear all while image editing. [97]

  • Make the stopship task more reliable. [98]

  • Support stop download and upload for documents. [99]

  • Add support to dynamically update Recipient data in group settings. [100]

  • Fix unit of retry-after header. [101]

  • Temporarily ignore flaky network test. [102]

  • Do not disable camera if undergoing a configuration change. [103]

  • Update conversation list for scheduled group message. [104]

  • Fix pinned chat ordering sent to storage service. [105]

  • Reset player position when video is finished. [106]

  • Fix DateTime conversions for search datePicker. [107]

  • Catch additional CDS exceptions to prevent crash. [108]

  • Only allow ACI auth for websocket at this time. [109]

  • Fixed internal setting behavior for forcing backup type. [110]

  • Fix handling of missing files during archive upload. [111]

  • Enable libsgnal-net for all nightly builds. [112]

  • Update to libsignal v0.68.0 [113]

  • Add handling for AppExpiredConnection in LibSignalChatConnection:connect. [114]

  • Fix wrong language being selected for system default. [115]

  • Reimplement main activity toolbars in compose. [116]

  • Dynamically compute MediaName and MediaId. [117]

  • Temporary fix for notification profile icon. [118]

  • Update to gradle 8.9.0 [119]

  • Fix some lint errors. [120]

  • Add compose bottom chrome. [121]

  • Fix witness verifications for OSX. [122]

  • Quiet excessive warnings. [123]

  • Remove ConversationListTabs enum. [124]

  • Add adaptive-layout and adaptive-navigation libraries. [125]

  • Add language support for Belarusian. [126]

  • Do not allow invalid thread merge events in backups. [127]

  • Add extra validation around shared contact backups. [128]

  • Fix witness verification for windows. [129]

  • Fix play console crash reports. [130]

  • Hide scheduled media from conversation settings. [131]

  • Add additional validations around quote authors during export. [132]

  • Provide retry UX for tier restore network failures. [133]

  • Improve Media Player current and remaining time logic. [134]

  • Move toolbar into main activity composable. [135]

  • Fix buttons weight distribution in QualitySelectorBottomSheet. [136]

  • Prevent showing Empty MediaPreview screen and avoid Camera/Gallery Stack. [137]

  • Update profile initials after name change. [138]

  • Disable the configuration cache (for now). [139]

  • Update translations and other static files. [140]

  • Update baseline profile. [141]

  • Bump version to 7.39.0 [142]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.38.7â€¦v7.39.0

Localization changes

No localization changes fit in character limit. You can view the full comparison to 7.38.7 so far here. Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

posts.name: Anon
posts.cooked:
Got Signal to freeze and after minimizing it One UI froze too.

I installed 7.39 update through Obtaninum.

Steps to reproduce:

Opened Signal, open Contact X chat, deleted it, send (first) message to that Contact, scheduled a image to tomorrow at 8 oâ€™clock.

Then I went to contact details, and then I opened and selected â€œ4 weeksâ€ from the auto delete option. And when I tapped the â€œSave buttonâ€ whole Signal froze.

I tapped everywhere and back gesture but nothing happened, eventually It showed me â€œSignal is not respondingâ€ pop-up. I tapped â€œwaitâ€ several times but it come up again and again.

Then I minimize d Signal app (bottom system gesture) and then One UI Home started lagging (notification panel was smooth, but the Home UI was laggy and then again smooth).

I closed Signal and tried again, and it worked.

If I recall correctly I think I saw 3/4 circle when I tapped that â€œSave buttonâ€ from auto-delete menu.

10000205201080Ã—2340 74.5 KB

Edit:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.39.0/ea2e9ac07983e6dfa23c89c79a81cccf0603c02a88d7d8276681aeaf8a8a37c1

posts.name: Anon
posts.cooked:
Just tried it again on another contact and I can confirm the bug is reproducible.

I triet it on my newly created empty group chat (without anybody but me) and Signal didnâ€™t bugged out this time.

It seems this bug is happening only on chats with contacts and when selecting â€œ4 weeksâ€ option from â€œ1 weekâ€ or â€œunlimitedâ€

posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

You can now schedule voice messages (need to lock recording first, then long-press send)

Now that you have done this, couldnâ€™t you also implement a pause button to pause the recording of voice messages? I know this is a feature request, but for me this sounds like a small easy thing, and I have heard several complaints from other users missing this simple feature a lot (I never do voice messages, therefore it doesnâ€™t affect me, but younger people (who canâ€™t write/spell ) seem to use and need that a lot to filter out their â€œuhmâ€, â€œhmmâ€ noises).

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
It is currently possible for an SIM jacker to lock you out of your Signal account by spamming Signal PIN attempts.

From the owners perspective they will be unregistered, they will try to reregister using their PIN, and will promptly be told itâ€™s wrong:

image900Ã—1600 56.1 KB

After trying to register normally they will be locked out of the account for 7 days.

This doesnâ€™t seem to be intended behavior, as previously entering your PIN even if your account was locked, would allow you to reregister if you had the original Signal install that was unregistered.

image900Ã—1600 58.1 KB

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.38.7/078fcb555261071f563e77b3bf0b8610ac89d73425538228ce07ccfa17bc3516

In logs you can see it is throwing an Unknown exception instead of the RegisterAccountResult.AttemptsExhausted you would expect when your account is actually locked.

This behavior is reproducible on iOS.

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
Navigating the calendar in the search menu of a conversation is very slow, specially noticeable if the chat history spans multiple years. Switching between months takes a couple of seconds, as well as loading the initial view of the calendar.

Also, thereâ€™s a bug present where the time zone is not correctly taken into account so if I select a day, letâ€™s say March 7th, the chat history jumps to march 6th.

New Version: 7.39.1 (153200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

7 new commits since 7.39.0:

  • Fix navigation bar lottie animation duration. [1]

  • Hide stories if feature is disabled. [2]

  • Fix content color in search field. [3]

  • Inline flag to enable auto-lower-hand for everyone. [4]

  • Update to libsignal v0.68.1 [5]

  • Update translations and other static files. [6]

  • Bump version to 7.39.1 [7]
